title: Should you use your old SIM card in a new phone? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sure, why not. You don’t have to hassle with your cellular provider, which most want to charge you $20 for the honor of taking your old SIM car putting in your new phone, and then tossing the new SIM card in a drawer anyway. Not sure how long they can actually last, but we’ll probably have stopped using SIM cards (moved to something new) before they actually die. And nobody uses the memory in them anymore, which was were all the contact information was stored prior to moving on to smartphones.

If you want to have the same phone number, definitely, you should. Your new phone may be locked and not allow your type of SIM, so check what phone you have, locked or unlocked, and check what carrier it is locked to (if it is locked). Hope this helps.
